intro: Afroligusticum mattirolii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
